PCIE iovalid enable valid mask creator: platform consumer: p10_pcie_scominit firmware notes: These are config dependent attributes based on PCIe Lane/sideband signal routing and PCIe endpoints attached.
We now have finite control of REFCLK at a PHB level versus PEC level for P9.
REFCLK will flush to 0. REFCLK is gated by IOVALID. Default is for REFCLK to equal 0b1 when IOVALID is enabled. REFCLK will be persistent (sticky) through a PHB reset similar to PERST# signal.
In the scenario where a server does not use a PHB, p10_pcie_scominit shouldn't enable IOVALID so REFCLK should be off.
